input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Hydranencephaly

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE A 28-YEAR-OLD FEMALE AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS FEMALE.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- An enlarged head that has been noticeable since birth
- Limited, jerky movements that seem to come and go
- Seizures occurring a few times a month
- Difficulties with vision, especially in low light
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION gradually over the past few months, with the head swelling becoming more prominent and the movements more inconsistent. I noticed I sometimes have trouble focusing my eyes and see shadows or blurriness. My seizures have increased in frequency, and I’ve been feeling more fatigued than usual. I was born with these issues, and my family history includes some genetic disorders, but I don’t remember specific details. I’m worried because I’ve read that these symptoms can be linked to a condition called hydranencephaly, which I understand is serious.
output:
THINKING: I need to explain clearly but also honestly, emphasizing my concerns and how I’ve been feeling lately. I want to mention the symptoms that have been worse recently and that I’ve noticed some changes. 
ANSWER: Well, I’m 28, and I’ve been having kind of a rough time lately. My head has been getting bigger, like more noticeable than before, and it makes me think maybe it’s been swelling more. I also have these jerky movements that come and go, and my seizures happen more often now — a few times a month. I’ve been feeling more tired than usual, and lately I’ve had trouble seeing in low light, like shadows or blurriness. I was born with these issues, and my family says they had some similar stuff, so I guess I just wanted to get checked out, maybe see if what’s happening now is connected to all that.
thinking: I need to explain clearly but also honestly, emphasizing my concerns and how I’ve been feeling lately. I want to mention the symptoms that have been worse recently and that I’ve noticed some changes.
answer: Well, I’m 28, and I’ve been having kind of a rough time lately. My head has been getting bigger, like more noticeable than before, and it makes me think maybe it’s been swelling more. I also have these jerky movements that come and go, and my seizures happen more often now — a few times a month. I’ve been feeling more tired than usual, and lately I’ve had trouble seeing in low light, like shadows or blurriness. I was born with these issues, and my family says they had some similar stuff, so I guess I just wanted to get checked out, maybe see if what’s happening now is connected to all that.
